verses.text: ¶ Come, and let us return unto Jehovah; for he hath torn, and he will heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up.
After two days will he revive us: on the third day he will raise us up, and we shall live before him.
And let us know, let us follow on to know Jehovah: his going forth is sure as the morning; and he will come unto us as the rain, as the latter rain that watereth the earth.
¶ O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your [a]goodness is as a morning cloud, and as the dew that goeth early away.
Therefore have I hewed them by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: and [b]thy judgments are the light that goeth forth.
For I desire [c]goodness, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt-offerings.
But they [d]like [e]Adam have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.

footnotes.d: Or, are as men that have transgressed a covenant

verses.text: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity; it is stained with blood.
[f]And as troops of robbers wait for a man, so the company of priests murder in the way toward Shechem; yea, they have committed lewdness.

footnotes.f: Or, And as robbers lying in wait, so etc.

verses.text: In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing: there whoredom is  in Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
Also, O Judah, there is a harvest appointed for thee, when I [g]bring back the captivity of my people.
